activities.name: Lolly and Spoon Race
instructions: Students line up at starting line with spoon and lolly
Hold spoon in dominant hand with lolly balanced on top
Walk/jog to finish line without dropping lolly
If lolly drops, stop and pick it up before continuing
Return to start and pass spoon to next student

modifications.kindy: Use larger spoons and shorter distance
modifications.year1_2: Can increase pace or add obstacles

activities.name: Ball Game - Over and Under
activities.setup: Students in lines of 6-8, arm's length apart
instructions: First student passes ball overhead to student behind
Second student passes ball between legs to next student
Continue alternating over/under pattern down the line
Last student runs to front and starts again
Continue until original first student returns to front

activities.name: Skipping
activities.setup: Spread students out with enough space to skip safely
instructions: Practice basic two-foot bounce
Try single foot hopping
Attempt running skip
Group counting challenges

modifications.kindy: Focus on turning rope and basic jumping

activities.name: Drink/Snack Break
activities.setup: Designated quiet area with shade if possible
instructions: Students sit in designated area
Supervised drink and snack time
Brief rest before next activity
Teachers use this time to check on students

activities.name: Bean Bag Relay Races (on head)
activities.setup: Teams of 4-6 students, lanes 15-20 meters long
instructions: Students balance bean bag on head
Walk to cone and back without using hands to steady bean bag
If bean bag falls, stop and replace before continuing
Pass bean bag to next team member
First team to complete wins round

modifications.kindy: Can use hands to steady if needed

activities.name: Mini Hurdles
equipment: Low hurdles or pool noodles on cones (6-10 inches high)
instructions: Students line up single file
Step or jump over each hurdle
Walk back along outside to rejoin line
Focus on safe landing and control
activities.safety: Ensure hurdles are low and soft materials used

activities.name: Pass the Hoop
activities.setup: Students stand in circle holding hands
instructions: Start with hoop around one student's arm
Pass hoop around circle without letting go of hands
Students must step through or maneuver hoop over their body
Time the group to see how fast they can complete circle
Try going in opposite direction

activities.name: Bean Bag in a Hoop
activities.setup: Place hoops at varying distances (2, 4, 6 meters)
instructions: Students take turns throwing bean bags into hoops
Start with closest hoop, progress to furthest
Different point values for different distances
Collect bean bags between rounds
activities.scoring: Closest hoop = 1 point, middle = 2 points, furthest = 3 points

activities.name: Drink and Snack Break
activities.setup: Designated quiet area with shade if possible
instructions: Students sit in designated area
Supervised drink and snack time
Brief rest before next activity
Teachers check on individual students

activities.name: Parachute
activities.setup: Open area with students spaced around parachute edge
instructions: Popcorn: Place lightweight balls on parachute, shake to make them 'pop'
Mushroom: Lift parachute high, pull down and sit on edge to create dome
Waves: Create small and large waves with different arm movements
Carousel: Hold with one hand and walk in circle
activities.safety: Ensure students maintain grip and follow instructions

activities.name: Tug-o-War
activities.setup: Mark center line clearly, divide into two equal teams
instructions: Teams grip rope with both hands
Pull steadily, no sudden jerking
Winning team pulls center marker past their line
Best of 3 rounds
Switch team members between rounds
activities.safety: Supervise closely, ensure no wrapping rope around bodies
